data.title: Move async `didStopChangingActiveItem` to `Pane`
data.body:
Functionality like focusing the newly active text editor lives in the
`Pane` class and needs access to the async `didStop` callback. Move the
functionality into `Pane` and keep the same API for `PaneContainer` by
adding a new subscription similar to its `observeActiveItem`
subscription.

Throttle the async version of `didChangeActiveItem` because debouncing
can lead to a UI that is significantly out-of-date compared with the
state expected by the user. For example, pressing and holding ctrl-tab
(next tab) would keep the event debounced for the duration of the
keypress. Throttling the event ensures most callbacks are still async
but are able to update the UI periodically if events are happening
quickly.

data.title: Side-by-side install of atom master?
data.body:
I currently can have one version of Atom and one version of Atom Beta installed on my machine side-by-side. As someone who works on `master` most of the time, I have to choose whether the version of Atom (non-beta) tracks against the Release channel or is just a local-built version of Atom.

Could we build support so that I could have Release, Beta and a local-built version of Atom all side-by-side?

data.title: Graphical glitch when waking up OS X from retina-MBP to non-retina monitor
data.body:
Steps I took:
1. Have a few windows open in Retina MacBook Pro.
2. Close the lid (OS X sleeps).
3. Connect MacBook Pro to monitor (Apple Cinema Display via Thunderbolt in my case).
4. Without ever opening the mbp's lid, wake up OS X to the connected monitor by pressing keyboard keys.
5. All atom windows will only attempt to render 1/4th of their frame (2nd quadrant — top left one). The rest are rendered white. See attached screenshot.
6. Resizing a window fixes its rendered frame.

![screen shot 2015-10-27 at 10 25 52 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/39792/10749935/fa5e8d16-7c95-11e5-826c-e99bb8ae570c.png)

Looks like it couldn't figure that the screen has switched to non-retina one.

data.title: find and replace covers selected word
data.body:
Hi,

I have created my own syntax theme but now when I use the find/replace tool it covers the word with the same colour as I us for selecting lines of code but I can't see what it has written.  Is this normal? have attached a picture as help if this is confusing.
![find and replace opac colour](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8998661/10742290/4c842686-7c24-11e5-9d03-54a3dd68a357.png)

data.title: Initial window load UI can be improved
data.body:
![initial load](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2766036/10740328/0df89310-7bf8-11e5-8c91-9f01974ef968.png)
There are a couple of issues here:
1. The only menu that appears is `Atom`.  If you click on that the commands that normally go in the `Atom` menu on Mac appear, but with the `Cmd-` part of the keyboard shortcut stripped off (eg `Cmd-R` --> `R`).
2. A large portion of the screen is white, which seems related to #8847.
3. As briefly mentioned in #8293, the window is showing up in an unmaximized state, but with dimensions that correspond to a maximized state.

Please note that I could only reproduce the first two issues on Windows 10 x64 using Atom 1.0.19, and not Atom 1.2.0-dev-9b46f7c.

data.title: I/O blocking when editing in mounted network directories
data.body: When I mount an ssh directory on my file system on Ubuntu 15.04 and open a file the editor freezes until the file is loaded. This also happens when saving files. This can be problematic if my network is slow or experiences interruptions since it can completely lock up the editor and cause it to crash.

data.title: displayBuffer.getVisibleRowRange in beta
data.body:
where did go getVisibleRowRange function from displayBuffer in beta version of atom?
there is some place that developer could track the changes in core functionality of atom?
if you are making a lot of changes in each release of atom a lot of plugins will stop working correctly but you know that already
maybe try to use adapters or something for compability reasons, or getters/setters for properties that in newer versions become functions, i don't know 
it is painfull to struggle with errors each time bigger update is released
of course beta is not released yet as stable but i don't know how i can repair my plugin to work with beta and whether reapair it or this is a atom bug or change
awww :]

data.title: When disconnecting a non-retina external monitor, Atom doesn't switch state while full screen
data.body: I have a retina MacBook Pro running El Capitan with two non-retina external monitors. If I have an Atom window full screen on a non-retina display and then disconnect my laptop, Atom will continue to be in low-resolution mode on the Retina display. Sizing is correct, but text is blurry.

data.title: Atom covers most of window with white when moving between two screens while in full screen
data.body:
I have a retina MacBook Pro running El Capitan with two non-retina external monitors. I will frequently start Atom, make it full screen on the macbook, and then in Mission Control, drag the full-screen window to an external monitor. When I do, most of the window is white:

![screenshot 2015-10-26 09 02 27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1298231/10730830/5d632c36-7bc0-11e5-8121-a0393def628a.png)

If I remove it from full screen and then go right back to full screen on the external monitor, it resets.

If I move the window to the external monitor before making it full screen, it works correctly.

If I make the window full screen on a non-retina monitor and then move it to the other non-retina monitor, it works correctly.

I'm guessing that Atom doesn't handle the switch between retina states while full screen well.

data.title: Duplicate files in sidebar removes extension in special filenames
data.body: When I'm duplicating a file in the sidebar with CTRL+C, CTRL+V it removes the extension if the filename has double dots, like: **index.blade.php** become: **index0.blade**

data.title: Windows freezing on gulp compile
data.body:
I have a 10/10 reproduction rate with this issue - when I'm watching a directory for changes with gulp and save a file, atom will freeze for an indeterminate amount of time. After a little while, the editor unlocks enough to toggle tabs which unfreezes things completely.

I can set up a git repo of my current project, if that would be helpful. Note that in the gif, the first time I select save from the menu while the second time I used Ctrl-S. It makes no difference for the purpose of reproducing this.

![Image of problem](http://g.recordit.co/RsX9DNxEq2.gif)

data.title: JSX - Component Import doesn't work with js-autoimport
data.body:
When changing the import line of code, Atom adds the same import automatically, multiple times.
Check this video:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B1UISLB95DfyMWV1NHlUZnpmOHM/view?usp=sharing

OS: Windows 7
Atom version: 1.0.19
Error occurs not in safe mode. (atom --safe)
Plugin causing ERROR: https://atom.io/packages/js-autoimport
After deleting, the import is working as intended.
